actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote tax parity between the residential and business fuel cell tax credits.
short_title: Fuel Cell Tax Parity Act of 2009

summary.text: Fuel Cell Tax Parity Act of 2009 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code relating to the tax credit for residential energy efficient property expenditures to: (1) increase to $1,500 the maximum dollar amount of the credit for fuel cell property expenditures; and (2) allow fuel cell property eligible for such credit to be installed in any residence of the taxpayer (currently, restricted to a principal residence).

titles.title: Fuel Cell Tax Parity Act of 2009
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to promote tax parity between the residential and business fuel cell tax credits.
